_comment: Created by EFisher on 24/01/2014 17:04:33 using v2.0
title: How did NHS staff sickness rates vary by staff type?
analysis_commentary: Absence rates also vary markedly by staff group. Staff groups with the highest sickness absence rates are healthcare assistants and support staff, ambulance staff, and nursing staff, with rates of 6.3%, 6.2% and 5.1%, respectively. Medical and dental staff , and nursery, midwifery and health visiting learners have the lowest rates over the analysis period, with a sickness absence rate of 1.2%.
data_source: Health & Social Care Information Centre, Sickness Absence Rates in the NHS. Department of health, Survey of NHS staff
